title: Watch Liverpool's Curtis Jones' stunning goal against Everton in the FA Cup third round
description: Watch 18-year-old Curtis Jones' spectacular winning goal for Liverpool against Everton in the FA Cup from all the angles.

title: Italian Alps: Six German tourists killed by 'drunk driver'
description: The driver of the car involved, a man in his late 20s, was arrested and is currently in hospital.

title: Labour leadership: Two contenders blame manifesto for trust issues
description: Sir Keir Starmer says offer was "over-loaded", while Jess Phillips said some plans were "not believable".

title: Ayia Napa: Raab urges Cyprus to 'do the right thing' in case of British teenager
description: The foreign secretary says his priority is to get the woman back to the UK to start her recovery.

title: Ibrahimovic statue toppled by vandals in Malmo
description: Vandals topple a statue of former Sweden striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic outside Malmo's stadium by sawing it off at the ankles.

title: Qasem Soleimani: Raab urges Iran to take diplomatic route amid tensions
description: The foreign secretary says the UK wants to avoid "a major war" after the US killing of Qasem Soleimani.

title: 'Serious cyber-attack' on Austria's foreign ministry
description: Foreign ministry officials believe another country may be responsible.

title: HS2 costs out of control, says review's deputy chair
description: Lord Berkeley says MPs were "misled" about the line's costs, which he says will be more than £108bn.

title: Everton must be perfect to win at Anfield - Ancelotti
description: Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti says his side's "game has to be complete" if they are to beat Liverpool at Anfield in the FA Cup on Sunday.

title: Soleimani assassination: Mourners flood the streets as body returns to Iran
description: Hundreds of thousands gather in Ahvaz where the assassinated general's body arrived ahead of burial on Tuesday.

title: Boat Race: First woman picked to umpire men's Oxford-Cambridge rowing fixture
description: An Olympic medallist will be the first woman to umpire the men's race in its 166-year history.

title: Australia fires: 'Ghostly feel' in Kangaroo Valley
description: The BBC's Phil Mercer reports from Kangaroo Valley in New South Wales, where fires are still smouldering.

title: Patriots' Brady 'unlikely' to retire despite play-off defeat
description: Tom Brady says it is "pretty unlikely" he will retire after his New England Patriots are knocked out of the NFL play-offs by the Tennessee Titans.

title: Australia bushfires: Fundraiser reaches A$20m in 48 hours
description: A Facebook appeal by Celeste Barber, an Australian comedian, has drawn more than 500,000 donations.

title: The Papers: 'PM jets in to Iran crisis' and 'SAS to Iraq'
description: Sunday's papers focus on the choices facing Prime Minister Boris Johnson as the Iran crisis grows.

title: 'I dropped out of school, now I sell £60,000 trainers'
description: Joe Franklin sells trainers to your favourite rappers - and it all started on his 12th birthday.

title: Why fewer US students want to learn about UK these days
description: British studies is on the decline in America, as students face new economic and global realities.

title: Golden Globe Awards: What you need to know
description: A quick guide to the first big film and TV awards ceremony of 2020, which takes place on Sunday.

title: Bono’s son’s band kick off the BBC’s Sound of 2020
description: Bono's son Elijah Hewson fronts Inhaler, who have come fifth on the BBC Sound of 2020 list.

title: Val d'Isere: The doctor who hid a Jewish girl - and the resort that wants to forget
description: A hidden story of wartime bravery in an Alpine resort, which some local people are reluctant to remember.

title: Farouk James: The boy with very long hair
description: Farouk James is famous for his hair. He models for big brands and is defying some critics who say boys should not have long hair.

title: India yak deaths: 'For humans to survive, yaks must too'
description: A shrinking yak population in India's north-eastern state of Sikkim has herders and locals worried.

title: Pocahontas Heacham mulberry tree DNA test 'inconclusive'
description: Researchers are unable to establish whether the Native American planted a mulberry tree in Norfolk.

title: Sunken chest syndrome: 'I'm being strangled inside'
description: Kerry Van Der Merwe has been fighting to be allowed surgery for a condition that baffles many GPs.
